data-set.name: MicroArray
data-set.intro-text: Microarray gene expression data formatted in mage-ml format can be loaded into FlyMine.

data-set.name: Protein Interactions
data-set.intro-text: Proteins formatted in the Proteomics Standards Initiative (PSI) molecular interaction (PSI MI) format can be mapped to the FlyMine data model.

data-source.name: D. melanogaster protein domain 3-D%3Cbr/%3Estructure predictions from Kenji Mizuguchi

data-set.name: INDAC
data-set.subtitle: Long Oligos
data-set.intro-text: Long oligos from the International Drosophila array consortium.

data-set.name: Tiling Path
data-set.subtitle: Microarray Tiling Primers
data-set.intro-text: Primers designed to tile across whole genomes or regions of genomes.

data-set.name: Genomics
data-set.starting-points: Gene Transcript Exon TRNA NcRNA Chromosome ChromosomeBand Orthologue Paralogue GOTerm RepeatRegion TransposableElement TFBindingSite Pseudogene RRNA SnRNA SnoRNA UTR MRNA

data-set.name: Gene Ontology
data-set.intro-text:
The Gene Ontology (GO) project is a collaborative effort to address the need for consistent descriptions of gene products in different databases.
The GO collaborators are developing three structured, controlled vocabularies (ontologies) that describe gene products in terms of their associated biological processes, cellular components and molecular functions in a species-independent manner.
GO terms are organized in structures called directed acyclic graphs (DAGs), which differ from hierarchies in that a child, or more specialized, term can have many parents, or less specialized, terms.
The three GO ontologies have been loaded into FlyMine and the hierachical structure of each can be browsed and queried.
Model organism databases annotate their gene products (or genes) with GO terms, providing references and indicating what kind of evidence is available to support the annotations.
GO annotations for D. melanogaster, C. elegans and A. gambiae have been loaded into FlyMine. The GO annotations are 'attached' to Genes and so each gene has a reference (link) to a list of it's GO annotations (if available).

data-set.name: Homophila
data-set.subtitle: Human Disease to Drosophila
data-set.intro-text: Homophila Human Disease to Drosophila Database (version 2.1).

data-set.name: Proteins
data-set.intro-text: Protein annotation (including family and domain annotation).

data-set.name: Comparative Genomics
data-set.subtitle: Orthologues and Paralogues
data-set.intro-text: Orthologues (equivalent genes in different species that evolved from a common ancestor by speciation) and Paralogues (genes from the same homologous superfamily found in another part of the genome of a particular taxon. Paralogues are the result of gene duplication).

data-set.name: DrosDel
data-set.subtitle: P-element Insertions and Deletions
data-set.intro-text: DrosDel P-element insertion and deletion locations.
